title: George King (rugby league)
text:
George King (born 1995) is an <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> international <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a and for <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Super%20League">Betfred Super League</a>.
He previously played for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> and the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>, and on loan from <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> at the <a href="North%20Wales%20Crusaders">North Wales Crusaders</a> in <a href="2015%20Championship%201">Championship 1</a> and the <a href="Rochdale%20Hornets">Rochdale Hornets</a> in the <a href="2018%20Betfred%20Championship">Betfred Championship</a>.
Background.
King was born in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
George is the older brother of <a href="Toby%20King%20%28rugby%20league%29">Toby King</a>: they both played their amateur rugby league at Meltham All Blacks, and George additionally played for Siddal. They were spotted by the Wires’ Yorkshire scout Tommy Gleeson after both appeared for Huddersfield.
In 2016 he was called up to the <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Ireland</a> squad for the <a href="2017%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%E2%80%93%20Europe%23Group%20B">2017 Rugby League World Cup European Pool B qualifiers</a>.
Warrington Wolves.
King was promoted to the <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington Wolves</a> first team squad in 2014. His Super League début was against the <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Bulls</a> in June 2014.
He played in the <a href="2016%20Challenge%20Cup%20Final">2016 Challenge Cup Final</a> defeat by <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
He played in the <a href="2016%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2016 Super League Grand Final</a> defeat by the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.
He played in the <a href="2018%20Challenge%20Cup%20Final">2018 Challenge Cup Final</a> defeat by the <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
He played in the <a href="2018%20Super%20League%20Grand%20Final">2018 Super League Grand Final</a> defeat by the <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> at <a href="Old%20Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.
Hull Kingston Rovers.
In September 2020 the club web site announced the signing of King from <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a>
King played a total of 20 games for Hull KR in the <a href="2021%20Super%20League%20season">2021 Super League season</a> including the club's 28-10 semi-final loss against the <a href="Catalans%20Dragons">Catalans Dragons</a>.
